div.head: Answer of Sir Henry Goodricke.
div.p: The Severall Answers of Sir Henry Goodricke Barronet Defendant to the Bill of Complaint of Forest Ashfield otherwise called Forest Edmond Ashfeild Gentleman Complainant

All advantages of Excepcion to the Incertaintyes Insufficiencyes and other imperfeccions in and by the Complainants said Bill of Complaint contained to the Defendant now and at all times hereafter saved for answere thereunto or unto soe much thereof as this Defendant is advices materially consernes this Defendant to make Answere
unto this Defendant answereth and saith that he hath heard that Rice Davis Esquire deceased in the Plaintiffs bill named was in his lifetime seized in fee simple of the Mannors and Lands in the Plaintiffs bill menccioned But there all Vallues of them or any of them this Defendant knows not neither doth this Defendant know beleive or
otherwise then by the Complainants Bill that the said Rice Davis on or about the Sixteenth day of December One thousand six hundred twenty four or at any other time for any consideracion whatsoever did settle and assure the same Mannors and premisses or any part thereof or him and Mary his wife and the Issue
of their two bodyes or made any other Settlement whatsoever of the said Mannors and premisses or any part thereof to any other uses whatsoever or ever saw any Deed or writing purporting any such Settlement But this Defendant hath heard and beleives it may be true that the said Rice Davis had Issue by the said
Mary his wife one only Child to Witt Elianor the Plaintiffs Grandmother And this Defendant knows not whether the said Rice Davis survived the said Mary his wife or noth neither doth this Defendant know or ever heard or was informed that the said Rice Davis upon the Marriage of the said Elianor the Plaintiffs said Grandmother with
Nicholas Pointz Esquire in the Plintiffs Bill named or at any other time did contract act or Article to Settle the premisses or any part thereof on the said Nicholas Pointz and Elianor his wife and the Issue of their bodyes with remaineder to the Issue of her body or to any other uses whatsoever neither doth this Defendant know or ever
heard or has been informed otherwise then by the Bill of any Fine or Recovery that the said Nicholas Pointz and Elianor his wife leoyed or suffered of the said Mannors and premisses or any part thereof or any Deed or Deeds executed by them leading the Use of any Fine or Recovery if any such were by them
Leaoyed or suffered nor has he ever seen any Deed or writing purporting such Articles or Settlement But this Defendant hath heard and beleived it may be true that the said Nicholas Pointz dyed without Issue by him on the body of the said Elianor begotten but about what time he soe dyed knows not And this Defendant hath alsoe
heard and beleives it may be true that the said Elianor the Plaintiffs Grandmother survived the said Nicholas Pointz and afterwards Intermarried with William Goodrick Esquire the Plaintiff Grandfather But whether any Settlement was made of the said premisses or any part thereof upon at or after that Marriage this Defendant knows
not nor did he ever hear of any such settlement otherwise than by the Complainants Bill or ever saw any writing or Deed purporting such settlement And this Defendant beleived the said William Goodrick had Issue by the said Elianor his wife one only Child to witt Elianor the Plaintiffs Mother who dyed in the lifetime of the said William Goodricke And by
her death all the Mannors and Lands whereof the said Elinor the Mother died seised did discend to the said Elianor the Plaintiffs mother as her sole Child and heire And this Defendant hath heard that the said William Goodrick the Plantiffs said Grandfather after the decease of the said Elinor his wife held and enjoyed all such Mannors and Lands whereof his said
wife dyed seized dureing his life by the Curtesey of England and that he dyeing dureing the Minority of the plantiffs said Mother She the said Elianor the plantiffs Mother was left under the care and tuition of Sir Francis Goodrick as her Guardian whilest he lived and after his Death she was under the care and Tuition of xxams Hester Goodrick or of Sidney Bere Esquire or xx one of them till she xx
came to the Age of One and Twenty years or untill she Intermarried with Mr Edmond Ashfeild the plaintiffs Father who was by Trade a Painter as this Defendant has heard & had no visible Estate of his owne as this Defendant has been informed And this Defendant hath heard that the said Rice Davis left at the time of his Death severall other Daughters as his
former wives who also claimed severall parts and shares in the said Mannors and premisses and held and enjoyed severall parts thereof accordingly untill such time as either the said William Goodrick the Plaintiffs Grandfather or the Guardians of the Plaintiffs said Mother purchased the same for her use And this Defendant hath also
heard and beleives that after the plaintiffs said Father and Mother had Intermarried (To witt) in Michaelmas terme in the nine and twentieth year of the reigne of our late Sovereigne Lord King Charles the second they did Levy and acknowledge to Sidney Bere Esquire and Robert Forrest Esquire and their Heirs or the Heires of one of them One Fifth
Sur Camzance de droit come eeo &c of the Mannors of Tickenham ats Ticknam with the appurtenances and of Twenty Messuages five Cottages Sixteene Barnes two lofts two Water Mills one Dove house Twenty two Gardens Twenty one Orchards Two hundred twenty one acres of Land two Hundred thirty three acres of Meadow
Two hundred and tenn Acres of pasture thirty four Acres of wood One hundred Acres of Furze and heath Five hundred acres of Moore Three pounds eight shillings rent and Common pasturs for all Cattle with the appurtenancesin Tickenham ats Ticknam Wraxall Cleavedon Nailsey Clapton Portbury Backwell Loxton
Stogursey and Shurton and that the uses of such Fine were in and by one Indenture bearing date the eighteenth day of January in the said nine and twentyeth year of the reigne of our late Sovereigne Lord King Charles the second made between the said Edmond Ashfeild and Elianor his wife of the one part And the said Robert Forrest and Sidney
Beer and one Francis Trestwell Plowden Esquire of the other part declared to be to such uses intents and purposes as the said Elianor by her last Will and Testament in writing or by any other Writing under her hand and seale attested by two or three credible witnesses should limitt direct & appoint And this Defendant hath also heard & beleived
that the said Edmond Ashfeild and Elinor his wife afterwards wantines moneys Did on or about the thirty first day of May in the year of our Lord One thousand six hundred seventy eight borrow of St Thomas Kiggons of Gruell in the County of Southampton Knight the summe of One thousand poundsand for secureity the
repayment thereof with Interest in and by one Indenture Tripartite bearing date the said one and thirtieth day of May in the said year of our Lord One Thousand six hundred seventy eight made between the said Edmond Ashfeild and Elinor his wife Sir Henry Goodrick of Great Ribston in the County of York Knight and Barronett
deceased and the said Sidney Berre of the first part the said Sir Thomas Higgons of the second part and Thomas Boteler of Lincolnes Inne in the County of Middlesex gentleman of the third part In consideracion of One thousand pounds to the said Edmond Ashfeild and Elinor his wife in hand paid by the said Sir Thomas Higgons and of Five shillings to
the said Sir Henry Goodrick and Sidney Beere in hand paid also by the said Sir Thomas Higgons they the said Edmond Ashfeild and Elianor his wife and the said Sir Henry Goodrick and Sidney Beere by their direccion Did demise grant bargaine and sell unto the said Sir Thomas Higgons All that the Mannor or Lordshipp of Tickenham with the
rights members and appurtenances thereof in the parish of Tickenham or elsewhere in the County of Somerset & all Messuages Houses Barnes Stables Outhouses Mills Courts Backsides Gardens Lands Meadows Pastures woods underwoods commeons Common of pasture Moores Heaths Furzes wast grounds rights to Royaltyes wetertids
Jurisdiccions priviledges rents services profitts and Hereditaments whatsoever to the said Mannor or Lordshipp belonging or in any wise appertaining And also all that their third part in three parts to be devided of the Mannor or Lordshipp of Stoke Rodney ats Rodney Stoke Cheddar and Priddy or elsewhere belonging to the said Mannor
with the rights members and appurtenances thereof in the said County of Somersett and the rents revercions remainders and services thereof To be had holden unto the said Sir Thomas Higgons his Executors Administrators and Assignes for and Dureing the Terme of one thousand years then next following and fully to be compleat and ended by and
under the yearly rent of one peppercorne But the said Indenture was by a provisoe or condiccion therein contained made defeazible on repayment of the said One thousand pounds and Interest at certaine days and times therein mencioned and now long since past and that in and by the said Indenture the said Edmond Ashfeild and Elinor his wife and the
said Sir Henry Goodrick and Sidney Beere did Covenant grant and agree to and with the said Sir Thomas Higgons that they would before the end of the then present Trinity Terme at the Costs of the said Edmond Ashfeild and Elianor his wife before his then Majesties Justices of the Court of Common Pleas at Westminister in due forme of Law acknowledge
and Levy unto the said Thomas Boteler and his Heirs One Fine Sur Connzance De droit Come ceo &c of the said Mannors Lordshipps Messuages Lands Tenements hereditaments and premisses above mencioned with the appurtenances And that such Find soe or in any of her manner or at any other time to be levyed should be and Enure to the uses
intents and purposes following (that is to say) In the first place for the coroborating strengthe unity and makeing good the said Demise and Grant unto the said Sir Thomas Higgons his Executors Administratores & Assignes for the said Terme of One thousand years and afterwards to such uses intents and purposes as the said Elianor Wife of the said Edmond
Ashfeild by her last Will and Testament in writing or by any other writing under her hand and seale attested by two or three credible witnesses should limitt direct or appoint And for want of such Limittacion direccion or appointment To the only use and behoofe of the said Elianor then wife of the said Edmond Ashfeild and of her heirs and
assignes forever And this Defendant hath heard and beleives that in persuance of the said Covenant the said Edmond Ashfeild and Elianor his wife and the said Sir Henry Goodrick and Sidney Beere Did in Trinity Terme in the thirtieth year of the reigne of our late Sovereigne Lord King Charles the Second acknowledge and Levy the said
Fyne accordingly to the said Thomas Boteler and his Heirs of the said Mannor and premisses As in & by the said Fine & Indenture whereto this Defendant for more certainety referre himselfe which more fully appear And this Defendant hath heard that the said Edmond Ashfeild short after makeing the said Morgage and levying the said Fine Dyed (saving the Plaintiff and such other issue on the said Elianor begotten as in the Plaintiffs Bill is sett forth And this Defendant hath alsoe
heard and beleives that some short time after the Death of the said Edmond Ashfeild the said Thomas Higgons wanted his money and the said Elianor Plaintiffs Mother being then a Widow and not having money to pay off the said Morgage Did borrow of the Lady Anne Gonning Eleven Hundred pounds and by Indenture bearing
date the five and twentieth day of October One thousand six hundred and eighty made between the said Elianor by the name of Elianor Ashfeild widow of the first part the said Sir Thomas Higgons of the second part and the said Lady Anne Gonning of the third part Therein reciting the said Morgage and that the said one thousand
pounds then remained unpaid He the said Sir Thomas Higgons in consideracion of One thousand pounds paid to him by the said Lady Anne Goning with the consent of the said Elianor Ashfeild did Assigne the said Mannors and premisses and all his Estate Terme and Interest therein to the said Lady Anne Goning and Shee
the said Elianor Ashfield in consideracion of One hundred pounds more to her in hand paid by the said Lady Anne Goning Did by the same Indenture grant release and confirme to the said Lady Goning all and every the said Mannors and premisses morgages as aforesaid to the Sir Thomas Higgons to hold to her for the remainder of the
said Terme of One thousand yeares But the same was Deseazible on payment by the said Elianor to the said Lady Anne Goning of Eleven hundred pounds and Interest at certaine Days therein mencioned then to come and long since past as thereby may appeare and unto which this Defendant for more certainty does also referr himselfe when the
same shall be produced And this Defendant hath heard and beleives and Doubts not but to prove that the said Elianor did by Indenture of Lease and Release bearing date the three and twentieth and four and twentieth days of November in the first year of the reigne of the late King James the Release being made between her the said Elianor
by the name of Elianor Ashfeild widow of the one part and Edward Gorges Esquire and William Rogers Esquire of the other part in consideracion of Five shillings of lawfull English money in the said Indenture of Lease mencioned and of Twenty shillings of like money in the said Indenture of Release mencioned to be to her in hand paid by the said Edward
Gorges and William Rogers and for diverse other good causes and consideracions the said Elianor thereunto moveing Did grant bargaine Sell alien Release and confirme to the said Edward Gorges and William Rogers their heirs and Assignes All that her Mannor or Lordshipp of Tickenham with all and singuler its rights members
and appurtenances in the said County of Somersett And alsoe All those her Mannors or Lordshipps of Rodney Stoke and Cheddar with all and singuler their rights members and appurtenances in the said County of Somersett and also All and singuler her Farmes Lands Tenements and Hereditaments scituate lyeing and being within the
severall Parishes of Backwell and Loxton or either of them in the said County of Somersett and all houses outhouses edifices buildings Dovehouses Barnes Stables Courts Yards Curtillages Gardens Orchards Lands Meadows Pastures feedings Commons profitts Comodityes Advantages hereditaments and Appurtenances whatsoever to the said
severall Mannors Lordshipps Farmes Tenements Lands and premisses and to every or any of them belonging or appertaining or therewith usually Occupyed or Enjoyed or accepted reputed Deemed or taken as part parcell or member thereof And also all other the Mannors Lordshipps Messuages Tenements Farmes Lands & hereditaments
whatsoever sictuate lyeing and being in the said County of Somersett whereof or wherein she the said Elianor Ashfeild was then seized of any Estate of Inheritance and the Revercion and Revercions Remainder and Remainders rents and services thereof and also All her Estate right title Interest use possession revercion
Challenges claime and Demand whatsoever of her the said Elianor of in & to or out of the said Mannors Lordshipps Messuages Tenements Farmes Lands Hereditaments and premisses To be had and holden unto the said Edward Gorges and William Rogers their heirs and Assignes forever To the only proper use and behoofe
of them and their Heirs and Assignes forever more And this Defendant further saith that he beleives and Doubts not but to prove that in and by one other Indenture bearing Date the day next after the said last Indenture of Release and made between the said Elianor Ashfield of the first part Richard Glanville of the City of Bristoll gentleman of the second
part and the said Edward Gorges and William Rogers of the third part reciting therein the said Indentures of Lease and Release and that a Marriage was then agreed on and intended shortly to be had and soloayoinzed between the said Richard Glanville and the said Elianor it was Declared and agreed by and between the said parties to
the said Indenture Tripartite and every of them and Especially by the said Richard Glanville testifyed by his being a party to and putting his hand and seale thereunto in manner and forme following (That is to say) That the said Lease and Release before mencioned were soe made as aforesaid by and with the Privity and consent
of the said Richard Glanville and upon this Trust and confidence in them the said Edward Gorges and William Rogers reposed That they and the survivor of them and the heirs of such Survivor should from time to time make such Leases Grants and Estates of all and singuler the before mencioned Mannors Lordshipps Messuages
//IMG_0364 and IMG_0366//
Tenements Farmes Lands Hereditaments and premisses or any part or parcell thereof and should quitt and suffer the rents Issues and profitts thereof to be had received taken and enjoyed by such person and persons as the said Elianor by any writing or writings Deed or Deeds under her hand and Seale or by her last Will and
Testament in writing testifyed by three or more witnesses which writings Deeds or Will the said Richard Glanville did thereby agree and consent that the said Elianor might and thereby he did enable her to make the same as if she were a feme sole should from time to time limitt order Direct or appoint and for want
of such direccion or appointment then as the heir of her the said Elianor should direct & appoint And also that he the said Richard Glanville would from time to time alow of and as much as in him lay ratify and confirme All such Leases Grants Estates and likewise all such disposicions of Rents as should be by
the said Elianor Glanville limitted ordered directed or appointed in pursuance and according to the true meaning of the said Indenture Tripartite but for more certainty this Defendant does referr himselfe to the said Deed And this Defendant has heard and beleives that the said Morgage soe made to the said Sir Thomas Higgons and so
Assigned to the said Lady Goning who afterwards intermarried with Sir Dudley North So now well vested in the other Defendant Thomas Merrick and that the Defendant Thomas Merrick and Sir William Merrick late Father to the said Thomas who had the interest in the said Morgage and to whome the said Thomas Merrick is Executor did at severall times
advance severall other great summes on the security of the said Morgage and other lands added to the said Security and other addicionall Securityes by the said Elianor Glanville in her life time which severall summes of money soe mencioned to be lent by the said Sir Thomas Higgons the said Lady Goning Sir William Merrick and Thomas
Merrick this Defendant beleives was really and bona fide Lent advanced and paid to the said Edmond Ashfeild and the said Elianor Glanville or one of them to serve their occasions and not to the ends and purposes in the Bill mencioned But for the more certainty thereof and of the said severall Assignements this Defendant doth referr himselfe to
the Answer of the other Defendant Thomas Merrick in whose hands he beleives the said Deeds now are And this Defendant hath heard and beleives that after the Intermarriage of the plaintiffs said Mother with the said Richard Glanville he the said Richard Glanville endeavored by severall ways and means to make the said settlement Invalid or at least to procure
her to settle the said Mannors and premisses or great part thereof on himselfe which She not consenting unto severall Suites happened thereabout betweene the said Richard Glanville and the plaintiffs mother and her said Trustees upon full hearing whereof the said Marriage settlement was by Decree of this Court Confirmed and all the said Richard
Glanvilles endeavors being frustrated he ever afterwards lived seperate from her And the said Elianor the plaintiffs Mother and her Trustees enjoyed the said Mannors and premisses afterwards till her Death And this Defendant further saith and doubts not but to prove that the said Elianor Glanville the plaintiffs Mother being of a sound
perfect and Disposeing mind memory and understanding Did on or about the thirtieth Day of July one Thousand Seven hundred and five duely make and publish her last Will and Testament in writing therein reciting the effect and purport of the said settlement made on her marriage with the said Richard glanville and thereby did in pursuance
of the power and Authority to her given and reserved Will and Devise that the said Edward Gorges and William Rogers their heirs and Assignes by and out of the rents and profitts of the said Mannors and premisses or by leaseing thereof or any part thereof under a small yearly rent or by Morgage or Sale thereof or of any part thereof in the first place
should satisfye and pay to Thomas Merrick Esquire the Executor of Sir William Merrick Knight deceased Two thousand give hundred pounds and Interest secured by a Morgage of the greatest part of the premisses and after payment thereof should in the next place pay to her Son the plaintiff Forest Edmond Ashfeild the summe of Tenn pounds To her Daughter Mary the summe
of Tenn pounds and to her Sonn Richard the like summe of Tenn pounds and the weekly sume of Five shillings to her Daughter Elianor during her life for her maintenance And as conserning all and singuler her said Mannors Lands and hereditaments in the said County of Somerset after the debts maintenances and porcion aforesaid should be paid she
Devised and bequeathed the same unto this Defendant by the name of Henry Goodrick Esquire Son of her Cousen Sir John Goodrick of Ribston in the County of York Barronet his heirs and Assignes forever and She alsoe gave and bequeathed these Legacyes following (that is to say) To her friends the said Edward Gorges and William Rogers Twenty pounds a peice to
be laid out on a peice of plate To Mr John Parrott one hundred pounds To John Baptist Stanbrid one hundred pounds To Mrs Mary Burgis five pounds To the Poor of the Parish of Tickenham Forty shillings and the Poor of the Parish of Backwell in the said County of Somersett the summe of Twenty Shillings to William Wale Tenn pounds a yeare
dureing his life so as the Parish of Wraxall did make him the same allowance towards his maintenance as they then did That bequest being intended only as an Augementacion of the maintenance Which Legacyes above mencioned she did thereby Order direct and appoint her aforesaid Trustees Edward Gorges and William Rogers to pay out of
the Rents and profitts of her said Estate within one year after her Decease And lastly she made this Defendant Sole Executor of that her Last Will and Testament As in and by the said Will duely proved in the prerogative Court of Canterbury in common forme and since alsoe proved protestes in this honourable Court whereto this Defendant for more certainty
referreth himselfe will more fully appeare And this Defendant further Saith and doubts not but to prove that the said Elianor Glanville in and by one Deed Poll bearing equall Date with her said Will Reciting likewise therein the said Settlement made on her said Marriage with the said Richard Glanville in pursuance of the said power & Authority
to her thereby given and reserved Did in and by the said Deed Poll by her Sealed and Executed in the presence of the persons whose names are therein indorsed as witnesses thereto Limitt order declare and appoint that the said Edward Gorges and William Rogers their heirs and Assignes immediately after her Decease should grant and
Convey All and singuler the said Mannors Lands Tenements & hereditaments in the said Indenture therein before recited mencioned or either of them Contained & in such manner as Councell should advice unto this Defendant by the name of Henry Goodrick Esquire son of Sir John Goodrick of Ribstan in the County of York Barronet his heirs and assignes forever he paying the
the Morgage money due thereon and all other her iust debts and the severall Legacyes given in and by her will bearing equall date therewith and to which Will Thomas Edwards Esquire John Fleming and Joseph Edwards gentleman were witnesses with and under a Provisoe or Condicion that if she the said Elianor should be minded to revoke of make void that
Deed and should by any writing either Endorsed thereon or by any other writing under her own hand and sealed and Executed by her in the presence of three or more substantial witnesses whereof two or more of such witnesses should be acting Justices of the Peace at the time of Sealeing thereof That then the said Deed Poll should cease and be void Any thing
therein contained to the contrary thereof in any wise notwithstanding To which Deed the Defendant Thomas Edwards John Fleming Joseph Edwards and Bohun Witherston are indorsed as witnesses to the said sealeing and executing thereof As in and by the said Deed Poll remaining in the Custody or power of this Defendant and whereto this Defendant referreth himselfe will more
fully appeare And this Defendant further saith that the said Elianor Glanville having made such Will and appointment as aforesaid and this Defendant having proved the said Will in manner aforesaid He this Defendant and the said Defendant Thomas Merrick on or about the third Day of august Cast accounted togeather of and concerning the Interest of the said Two thousand seven
hundred and fifty pounds and upon that Account it appeared that all the Interest for the said Two thousand seven hundred and fifty pounds from the said third Day of November one thousand seven hundred and six to that time amounted to the summe of Three hundred seventy eight pounds two Shillings and two pence And this Defendant having moneys to pay the summe
was contented should be made principle and added to the said Two thousand Seven hundred and fifty pounds which made at the whole Three thousand one hundred twenty Eight pounds two shillings and two pence and thereupon in and by one Indenture bearing date the said third day of August last past made between this Defendant of the one part and the Defendant Thomas
Merrick of the other part reciting therein the effect and substance of the said severall Morgages and the said Account made up as aforesaid He this Defendant for the better sercureing and more sure payment of the said summe of Three thousand one hundred twenty eight two shillings and six pence with Interest for the same to the said Thomas Merrick
Did remise and release unto the Defendant Thomas Merrick his Executors Administrators & assignes the provisoe or condicion in the said last Indenture contained and all benefitt and equity of redempcion of the said premisses by virtue or Colour thereof And this Defendant for the consideracions and in consideracion also of the further summe of One pound seventeen
shillings and six pence in hand paid by the said Thomas Merrick Did release ratifye and confirme unto the said Thomas Merrick All and singuler the said Mannors Messuages Lands Tenements Hereditaments and premisses above mencioned with the appurtenances To hold to the said Thomas Merrick his Executors Administrators & Assignes for & dureing
all the rest and residue of the severall Termes of one Thousand years and one Thousand years which had been thereof Granted as were then to come and unexpired But the said Indenture was by a Provisoe or condiccion therein contained made Defezible on payment by this Defendant unto the said Thomas Merrick of the full summe of Three thousand two hundred
and eight pounds and Five shillings at a certaine Day therein mencioned then to come and now past As in and by a Counterpart of that Indenture remaining in this Defendants power or custody ready to be produced in this Honourable Court may more fully appeare and this Defendant further saith that he wanting moneys to pay off and Discharge the severall Legacyes given by
the said Elianor Glanvill's Will and likewise to put the Houses and premisses in repaire He this Defendant on or about the six and twentieth day of September last borrowed of the said Defendant Thomas Merrick the further summe of Three hundred forty six pounds fifteen shillings and four pence and for returneing the repayment thereof with interest in and by one
Indenture bearing date the summe six and twentyeth day of September reciting therein the substance and effect of the said severall former Securityes and that the Interest of the said Three thousand one hundred and thirty pounds from the said third Day of August then last to that Day amounted to the summe of Twenty three pounds four shillings and eight pence
and being added to the said summe of Three thousand one hundred and thirty pounds made in the whole the summe of three thousand one hundred fifty and three pounds four shillings and eight pence and that this Defendant having occasion for the further summe of Three hundred forty six pounds fifteen shillings and four pence had that day borrowed and
received the same of the other Defendant Thomas Merrick and the said Three hundred forty six pounds fifteen shillings and four pence being added to the said Three thousand one hundred fifty three pounds four shillings and eight pence made in the whole three thousand five hundred pounds He this Defendant as well for the better secureing the said Three thousand
one hundred fifty three pounds four shillings and Eight pence so due and owing to the said Thomas Merrick as aforesaid as for the better secureing the repaying of the said Three hundred forty six pounds fifteen shillings and four pence so by this Defendant then borrowed and received as aforesaid of the said other Defendant Thomas Merrick with interest for both the said
summes Did Remise and release unto the said Defendant Thomas Merrick his Executors Administrators and Assignes the provisoe or condicion in the last Indenture contained and all benefitt and Equity of redempcion of the said premisses by virtue or colour thereof or otherwise howsoever And this Defendant for the consideracions aforesaid and in consideracion also of the summe of Five shillings
of lawfull money in hand paid by the said Defendant Thomas Merrick did release ratifye and confirme unto the said Thomas Merrick All and singuler the said Mannors Messuages Lands Tenements hereditaments and premisses above mencioned and every part and parcell thereof with the appurtenances To hold to the said Defendant Thomas Merrick his Executors Administrators and
assignes for and Dureing all the rest and residue of the said severall termes of One thousand years and one thousand years above mencioned which were then to come and unexpired Clearly and absolutely freed and Discharged of and from the provisoe or Condicion in the last Indenture contained and of and from all Equity and power of Redempcion by virtue or
colour thereof or otherwise howsoever But the said last Indenture was by a provisoe or condicion therein contained made Defeizible on payment by this Defendant unto the Defendant Thomas Merrick of the full summe of Three thousand five hundred eighty seven pounds and tenn shillings at a certain Day then to come and now past And this Defendant
utterly Denyes that he either knows or ever heard of any other settlement Appointment Morgage or other Conveyance whatsoever that were ever made of Executed of the said Mannors and premisses or any part thereof either by the Plaintifs Grandfather or Grandmother or by his said Father and Mother or either of them than what is herein before or herein after
sett forth And this Defendant confesseth That after the Death of the said Elianor Glanville he did by virtue of her said Will and appointment by himselfe and Agents enter into the said Mannors and premisses or the greatest part thereof But as yett hath received very little advantage thereby having been forced to pay and expand more then the yearly value thereof in
payment of the said Defendant Merricks Interest and in repairing the premisses But this Defendant does insist that he is not accomptable to the Complainant for the same and therefore does not sett forth the rents and profitts received out of the premisses And this Defendant Confesseth that he hath alsoe lett severall parts of the said premisses for the best Rents he could gett but in letting thereof
he hath been constrained to sett the premisses in repair which will cost more moneys then the income of the Estate will raise for some years and this Defendant hath also made severall Leases for lives to severall Tennants at Rodney Stoke and taken such Fines as he could gett therefore (having as he is advised) good right to doe and hopes he may doe And this
Defendant hath heard that the said Elianor Glanville in her life time sold some Lands in Loxton but to whoms or for what knows not And this Defendant confesseth he hath often heard and verily beleives that the plaintiff was very extravagant in his way of living and very undutifull to his mother having seen severall Letters and papers of hers to that
purpose which he beleives was the occasion of her Disinheriting of him and not for the pretended reason in the Bill of his being reformed from the Errors of the Romish Church which he takes to be a meer ficcion of the Plaintiff Because this Defendant hath been informed he still continues a Roman Catholique Besides had that been any reason
it must consequently have been an Objeccion against her settleing the same on this Defendant who never was a member of the Church of Rome buth hath ever been both by educacion and Inclinacion a member of the Church of England And this Defendant doth confesse that he hath declared and as the truth is that the said Edward Gorges dyed first and the said
William Rogers him survived and is since Dead but the Exact time when either of them dyed knows not And this Defendant doth confesse that rubbed out or omitted space Rogers Spinster being sole Child and heir of the said William Rogers he hath procured a conveyance from her to him this Defendant and his heirs of the Legall Interest in the said Mannors and premisses as with the favor
of this honourable Court humbly hopes was lawfull for him to Doe And this Defendant Confesseth he had no perticuler acquaintance with or personall knowledge of the plaintiffs said Mother having to his knowledge never seen her or Corresponded with her and therefore cannot give any account as to her Sanity of mind and understanding and Denyes
he was ever Informed she was a Lunatick or Crazy except by the Complainant or his Agents But hath been informed and verily beleives and Doubts not but to prove she was a person of very good sence and understanding and very well knew what she Did and how to Manage and dispose of her Estate And that the consideracion of the great Debt thereupon and the carelesness and
negligance of the Plaintiffs was such that he would soon have wasted and sold the same was the great Inducement of her leaving the same to and settleing it upon this Defendant upon a prospect and hopes that this Defendant would preserve the same as being a very near Relacion to witt a Son of a Cozen German once removed and of the Sirname of her Father by whose prudence

Complainants Bill contained this Defendant Saith he is a meer Stranger thereto and can therefore make noe further Answere thereabout save that this Defendant beleives that the Plaintiff having entred upon and Disturbed some of his Tennants and taken away some Hay his agents ordered him to be Arrested therefore but not to be held to Bayle and as
informed the writt on which he was arrested did not require Speciall Bayle and the Plaintiff gave only an Appearance thereto and finding the Plaintiff not persist in his Injurys the Cause was Dropt and noe further proceedings therein as this Defendant hath been informed by his Attorney And this Defendant Denyes all Combinacion in the Bill charged without
that that any other matter or thing in the Complainants said Bill of Complaint contained materiall or effectuall for him this Defendant to make answere unto as is not herein and hereby well and sufficiently answered unto Confessed or avoided traversed or Denyed is true to the knowledge or beleife of him this Defendant All which matters and things this Defendant is
willing and ready to Averr maintaine and prove as this Honourable Court shall direct and humbly prays to be hence dismist with his resonable Costs and Charges in this behalfe most wrongfully sustained.
